Comment: This summary is incorrect in the first sentence. He was not in the country legally. He was an illegal alien with a withholding of removal, which can only be granted once an alien has been ordered removed. Basically, the government wanted to deport him but opted to hold off on it due to conditions in his home country. They could have removed him to a different country, or revoked his withholding of removal based on conditions changing in his home country. Having a withholding of removal is different from having asylum and doesn't allow the alien to adjust status towards getting more permanent residence or citizenship.   Edit: reading the rest of it anyway despite my issue with the first sentence, it is a pretty comprehensive analysis.   Edit 2: wait a fucking minute, this guys Withholding of Removal only said that he couldn't be removed to Guatemala? And now he's been removed to his native El Salvador? What's the issue?
Author: Mountain_Man_88

Comment: The judicial branch is not allowed to rule on these manners outside of federal law.
